title: Starship successfully completes 11th flight test
summary:
SpaceX successfully completed the final flight of version 2 of Starship on Oct. 13, performing in-flight tests as the company prepares to introduce an upgraded version of the reusable rocket.
The post Starship successfully completes 11th flight test appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Surprise Chinese launch sends Shiyan-31 experimental satellite into orbit
summary:
China conducted an orbital launch Monday with no apparent advance indication, successfully sending the Shiyan-31 remote sensing test satellite into orbit.
The post Surprise Chinese launch sends Shiyan-31 experimental satellite into orbit appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: More layoffs at JPL
summary:
NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory will lay off 550 employees this week, the latest round of job cuts at the space science center.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX poised to launch 24 Amazon Kuiper satellites following days of weather delays
summary: The launch comes following several stormy days across Florida’s Space Coast. Liftoff of SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force is scheduled for 8:08 p.m. EDT (0008 UTC).

title: DLR Delivers Callisto Landing Leg Prototype for Testing
summary:
The DLR Institute of Structures and Design has delivered the qualification model of the Callisto reusable rocket demonstrator’s landing leg to the DLR Institute of Space Systems in Bremen for testing. Callisto is an international reusable rocket demonstrator jointly developed by DLR, CNES, and JAXA. The project’s primary goal is the development and maturation of […]

title: Special economic zones for restoring American space dominance
summary:
Will China beat America in returning astronauts to the moon? We hear this question time and again. It is a perennial concern, both from a prestige and national security standpoint. title: Momentus and Solstar to offer communications, transportation and infrastructure in low-Earth orbit
summary:
BRISBANE, Australia – Momentus and Solstar Space announced a three-year agreement Oct. 13 to expand communications, transportation and infrastructure services for government and commercial missions in low-Earth orbit. The reciprocal-services agreement is designed to combine “the respective strengths, products and services of each company to deliver comprehensive low-Earth orbit space capabilities to address a broad […]
